text: The Villanova University is a private university in Villanova, Pennsylvania. The university has about 9,535 students. It was founded in 1842. The current president of the university is Rev. Peter M. Donohue, O.S.A. The school has also produced Pope Leo XIV, the first U.S.-born Pope. ==Sports== The athletics teams of the university are called the Wildcats. They have 24 varsity teams, most of which compete in the Big East Conference. The football team plays in the Colonial Athletic Association, and the women's rowing team is a member of the American Athletic Conference. ==Sources== ==Other websites== *Villanova University's Official website *Villanova Wildcats' Official athletics website Category:Big East Conference Category:Colleges and universities in Pennsylvania Category:Christian colleges and universities in the United States Category:1842 establishments in Pennsylvania
title: Villanova University
